events.originalText: Gol Transportes Aéreos Flight 1907 collided in mid-air with an Embraer Legacy business jet near Peixoto de Azevedo, Brazil, killing 154 people and triggering a national aviation crisis.
events.subtitle: Gol Transportes Aéreos Flight 1907
events.headline: Gol Transportes Aéreos Flight 1907 Collides with Embraer Legacy Jet, 154 Dead in Brazil

events.originalText: Archaeologists and volunteers began excavation of the remains of Fort Tanjong Katong in Singapore.
events.subtitle: Fort Tanjong Katong
events.headline: Excavation Begins at Fort Tanjong Katong in Singapore

events.originalText: The award-winning Disney animated film Beauty and the Beast premiered while unfinished at the New York Film Festival.
events.subtitle: Walt Disney Animation Studios
events.headline: Disney's Beauty and the Beast Premieres Unfinished at New York Film Festival

events.originalText: The Lockheed YF-22, the prototype for the F-22 Raptor, made its first flight.
events.subtitle: Lockheed YF-22
events.headline: Lockheed YF-22 Prototype Makes First Flight

events.originalText: The University of East Anglia was founded in Norwich, England, after talk of establishing a university in the city began as early as the 19th century.
events.subtitle: University of East Anglia
events.headline: University of East Anglia Founded in Norwich, England

events.originalText: An explosion at the Soviet nuclear reprocessing plant Mayak released 74 to 1,850 PBq of radioactive material.
events.subtitle: Nuclear reprocessing
events.headline: Explosion at Soviet Nuclear Plant Mayak Releases Radioactive Material

events.originalText: The first Indonesian legislative election resulted in an unexpectedly poor result for the Masyumi Party of incumbent prime minister Burhanuddin Harahap (pictured).
events.subtitle: 1955 Indonesian legislative election
events.headline: First Indonesian Legislative Election Results in Poor Outcome for Masyumi Party

events.originalText: Willie Mays of the New York Giants made The Catch, one of the most famous defensive plays in the history of Major League Baseball.
events.subtitle: Willie Mays
events.headline: Willie Mays Makes The Catch in Major League Baseball

events.originalText: Twelve countries signed a convention to establish the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN), which manages the world's largest particle physics laboratory.
events.subtitle: CERN
events.headline: Twelve Countries Sign Convention to Establish CERN

events.originalText: The Holocaust: Nazi forces, aided by Ukrainian collaborators, began a massacre of Jews in a ravine in Kyiv, killing more than 30,000 civilians in two days and thousands more in the following months.
events.subtitle: The Holocaust
events.headline: Nazi Forces Begin Massacre of Jews in Kyiv

events.originalText: During a Royal Australian Air Force training exercise over Brocklesby, two planes collided and interlocked in mid-air (pictured); the pilot of the upper plane was able to land safely using the lower plane's engines.
events.subtitle: Royal Australian Air Force
events.headline: Planes Collide in Mid-Air During RAAF Training Exercise over Brocklesby

events.originalText: The Mandate for Palestine came into effect, officially creating the protectorates of Mandatory Palestine under British administration and Transjordan as a separate emirate under King Abdullah I.
events.subtitle: Mandate for Palestine
events.headline: Mandate for Palestine Creates Protectorates under British Administration

events.originalText: World War I: The Battle of St Quentin Canal took place, which led to the British Fourth Army making the first breach of the German defensive Hindenburg Line.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Battle of St Quentin Canal Leads to Breach of Hindenburg Line in WWI

events.originalText: The Spanish American wars of independence ended with the death of King Ferdinand VII, with what had once been the Spanish Empire disintegrating into independent Latin American states.
events.subtitle: Spanish American wars of independence
events.headline: Spanish American Wars of Independence End with Death of King Ferdinand VII

events.originalText: The Williamsburg Bray School, the oldest-surviving school building in the U.S. dedicated to educating Black children, opened at Benjamin Franklin's suggestion.
events.subtitle: Williamsburg Bray School
events.headline: Oldest-Surviving School for Black Children Opens in Williamsburg Bray School

events.originalText: An army of Viking pirates that had besieged the English city of Canterbury for weeks took Archbishop Ælfheah prisoner and seized power.
events.subtitle: Siege of Canterbury
events.headline: Viking Pirates Take Archbishop Ælfheah Prisoner in Canterbury
